name: places/ChIJw4IePMJYwokRJNK0N35kRBA
adrFormatAddress: 1153 1st Ave., New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: Alexandria the receptionist is very nice and is very fast.Office is busy in the morning she signs in patients quickly and puts us in a room to then wait for ultrasound technician.Dr.Difiore is very down to earth I feel like I'm not pressured to do the procedures Call center is a disaster!!!!!.My legs feel better I have to come back soon for my follow up very happy with results.

originalText.text:
Expect: waiting at least one hour even with appointment and no clarity with the service. Also, even if they only ask you to sign a consent, I recommend you always read it.

In the first contact I explained I have spider vein so it would be cosmetic treatment. They booked me on Monday and feel hours prior to the appointment I was told they don’t accept self pay since I don’t have insurance. I called to the appointment service again which was surprise with it and they booked me with the doctor on Friday and when I got there I was told that doctor doesn’t treat spider vein and I have to book with Dr. Haley. I should have stopped here and go somewhere else, but I contacted them again and booked with Dr. Haley.
Appointment seems fast and first thing he said was to do surgery and when I asked how much, he didn’t tell me and said that the injections treatment would work. I workout with PT every day so I was concerning about the pos treatment and he told be it would be only 24 hours resting and I would be fine to work out after that.
I booked the appointment for the injections and after waiting 1 hours they put me in the room for more 30 minutes, after someone talk to me 2-3 minutes, they left me in the room again. Then, they was asking for my insurance to do another treatment. I said I was there for the injections which I left the groupon (recommended by them) in the reception, so why they are telling me about other treatment.
They said I was booked for other treatment and left me again in the room.
The nurse came back with a consent and just showed me the page to sign. I asked to read and have the opposite instructions for post treatment. I have to resting 15 days. Why the doctor told me something else? If I followed what he said and happen something, it would be my problem because I signed a consent with different instruction.
I didn’t feel comfortable and safe to do anything with someone in this clinic, so I decide to leave after 2 hours. My 1 star is for the overall service.

originalText.text: The doctor and people who work in the office are great. The appointment scheduling is a disaster. Three times, the system changed my appointment to a time when I was not available without consulting me. Twice, I showed up at the actual time they had scheduled me and they took me. Yesterday, I showed up for my actual appointment time in the freezing rain and the office was closed for the day. When I called, they said I was a no-show for my noon appointment. I had never made a new appointment-- the system changed it without my consent again. I am finding a new vein doctor even though they have all my records-- this is insane.

I had never made a new appointment-- the system changed it without my consent again. I am finding a new vein doctor even though they have all my records-- this is insane.

originalText.text: I enjoyed my visit. Felt welcomed and comfortable. Professional, reliable and courteous. Everyone was kind and helpful. It was a quick but thorough appointment for a renewal.

text.text: I enjoyed my visit. Felt welcomed and comfortable. Professional, reliable and courteous. Everyone was kind and helpful. It was a quick but thorough appointment for a renewal.

originalText.text:
MD Luise has no empathy for patients.
She was ready do another procedure on left leg even though she damaged my nerve on the right leg. No clear answer on how long the transient parasthesia will last.
